info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 6:08AM EDT until April 7 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
Muscatatuck River at Vernon.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
East Fork White River at Columbus to Seymour and at Williams.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River near Rivervale to Bedford and at Shoals.
.Significant and some major flooding is already occurring or expected to develop along the East Fork White River and its immediate tributaries in Shelby and Bartholomew Counties...due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall...and additional rains expected through Sunday. The crest on the East Fork should be in the Columbus and Seymour areas around Sunday evening and points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
* WHEN...Until Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Extensive flooding along left bank affects business and residential property along Boggstown Road. Rural flooding of a few homes near CR 100N and Boggstown Road on April 21, 2011.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EDT Saturday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 915 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING
